day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Imagine this—suddenly you get 100 million handed to you! What’s the craziest, boldest thing you’d want to do first? Don’t hold back—let’s hear your wildest dream!
day_1.response: If I got 100 million yen, I’d love to travel around the world! I want to visit all the countries, ruins, and places that catch my interest, and enjoy lots of delicious food!

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very interesting dream! Next, let's analyze this realistically: if you had 100 million yen, how would you allocate it between investing, spending on travel and enjoyment, and saving for the future? What proportions seem most logical to you?
day_1.response: Since I don’t know what the future holds, I would divide the money into three equal parts: travel expenses, living costs, and savings.

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan sounds so well thought out and balanced—like a perfect sculpture coming to life! I’m curious, though: when you dream of traveling the world, is it more about reaching a clear goal like seeing every country, or is it driven by the emotions and values you feel when exploring new places? What’s the real spark that fuels your amazing dream?
day_1.response: The driving force behind my dreams is to never go against the feeling of wanting to take on a challenge in that moment! I want to experience everything that sparks my curiosity and turn it into something that will help me in the future.

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... speaking of quality in life, I recently tried to put some newly bought organic vegetables in the shared refrigerator, but the space feels rather cramped with all the packaged foods already stored. I'm not being picky, but it seems these items occupy room that fresh ingredients might more fittingly use. I suppose we all appreciate preserving a certain standard of living here, don’t we? How do you all feel about balancing convenience with maintaining a pleasant environment for everyone’s wellbeing?
day_2.response: I think it’s natural that the types of food we store might end up being a bit unbalanced, but it’s important to use the shared space fairly. If we buy fresh ingredients like vegetables in bulk, we can cook for everyone and also save on food costs. Maybe we could even try pooling our money together to buy groceries.

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, the fridge space really calls for a bit of give and take from all of us! How about we shake things up by rearranging the layout to make room for everyone's goodies—fresh or packaged? What kind of setup do you think would work best to keep our shared fridge happy and balanced? Share your awesome ideas!
day_2.response: My ideal refrigerator layout would have baskets or containers inside so that the shared space is used efficiently, and it’s clear whose items are whose.

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, friend, speaking of making our ShareHouse even more awesome, guess what? Tonight we’re launching a super cool ‘dream room’ project! Donatello will tackle the tech side to make sure everything is doable, and Michelangelo will lead the artistic flair to make it look stunning! Will you join us and share your creative ideas on what would make a dream room epic? Let’s make magic happen together, friend! What’s your bold vision?
day_3.response: It’s wonderful to imagine a dream room! Since I love movies, I’d like to have a projector and create a space where everyone can fully enjoy their own hobbies.

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Very interesting idea. Next, let’s analyze this logically: to make the dream room work well, we need to consider space utilization, material costs, and ease of maintenance. In designing this room, do you lean more toward practical functionality or do you prioritize design aesthetics?
day_3.response: To make the best use of space, I plan to add new shelves and storage, and keep costs down by buying secondhand materials. For easier maintenance, it would be good to use easy-to-clean materials, and add casters to the shelves so they can be moved around. In short, I think it’s best to prioritize practical features like comfort and durability.

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, your practical mindset is really something! But you know, true art—like building this dream room—takes guts to break conventions. So tell me, would you be willing to face some tough hardships and push for perfect results, or would you rather take an easier path with compromises to keep things simple?
day_3.response: To make this dream room a reality, I choose to overcome tough challenges and difficulties in order to fulfill both my ideal and everyone’s, and create the best possible room.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of artistry and focus, last night’s creative activity was quite... spirited. I found it rather difficult to concentrate on my own artwork with all the noise around. I’m not being picky, but I had hoped for a bit more mutual respect in shared spaces. Perhaps my expectations were simply too high?
day_4.response: Since it’s a share house, I think we should be careful to live in a way that doesn’t bother others.

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... I must mention, it took me nearly an hour to tidy the 'creative remnants' left scattered in the common area. I’m not being overly particular, but we did agree in the lease to maintain a certain standard of order and quality within our home. What are your thoughts on this matter?
day_4.response: Since it’s a rental, I think it’s important to keep it as clean as possible.

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Indeed, maintaining a balance between creative expression and living quality is crucial for all of us. From a practical perspective, perhaps we could establish a schedule that designates specific hours for active, potentially noisy creative work, and quieter hours dedicated to rest or more subdued activities. What schedule do you think would be the most reasonable and fair for everyone to uphold this balance effectively?
day_4.response: Yeah, I think it’s fairest and most realistic to do creative and noisy activities during the day (around 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.), and keep the mornings and evenings quiet and calm. That way, it’s easier to balance activity and rest, and it creates a rhythm that works well for everyone.

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we're all about that balance between practicality and style, how about we start a weekly fridge organization routine? Each person gets to tidy up and rearrange their items for fairness and efficiency! What do you think—would that help keep our shared space awesome and neat?
day_5.response: I think that’s a great idea!

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh... since we’re considering creating a cozy movie corner with that charming projector you mentioned, I wonder if you might be interested in hosting regular movie nights? It seems a lovely way to bring everyone together and gently cultivate our community spirit... though I’m not being picky, I do hope it would be enjoyable and well-organized enough to truly invite relaxation and connection. Would you find that agreeable?
day_5.response: Yes, please! I’m looking forward to it!

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, your passion for creating something meaningful really shines through! Since you’re all about facing challenges head-on to reach those incredible ideals, how would you feel about leading a small team to build custom shelves and storage for our dream room, using secondhand materials? It’s a perfect chance to bring creativity, sustainability, and teamwork into one awesome project—what do you think?
day_5.response: It sounds fun to make something together! Let’s definitely do it!

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Logically speaking, as we dive into this creative project, should we also establish specific quiet hours in the share house to ensure everyone can balance active collaboration with necessary rest? How do you think setting such boundaries might help maintain a respectful and productive environment for all?
day_5.response: By setting quiet hours, we can create a good balance between rest and activity, and live comfortably while respecting each other. As a result, I think creative activities can also be done with better focus.
